TopicTitle: [WIP][1.8.x] SSTULabs - Low Part Count Solutions (Orbiters, Landers, Lifters) - Dev Thread [11-18-18]

Articles.Content: Not sure it works,haven't tested it yet (waiting for mods to update to 1.2).

same here  

in the meantime I'm messing with the SSTU station module, namely the solar panel part... I just made that SM I posted months ago even better ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")  

and also added Nertea's Near Future Solar panels to the SSTU solar panel list ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

Orion SM with circular panels?  

Send me that patch please ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
I just had a go with SSTU in 1.2-it all seems to work in-<abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> but the autofairing on the SC-C doesn't work along with the commands like "Extend Panels".

> I just had a go with SSTU in 1.2-it all seems to work in-<abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> but the autofairing on the SC-C doesn't work along with the commands like "Extend Panels".

Shadowmage is working on an update for 1.2, it'll be ready when it's ready, the current versions are NOT 1.2 compatible, there are plenty of changes that he had to address. Past that, 1.1.3 works just fine. So no need to report things that don't work with 1.2, *he knows*.

You have few posts, so I'll assume you are new. Usually it takes a while for mods to update after a patch, particularly a substantial one like 1.2. If you read up the thread for the last several pages, you will see many progress reports from shadowmage on how moving it forward to 1.2 is going. It sucks to be so very spoiled by a such a great mod, but we can survive until it gets updated ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") .
I've had the game since 2014, just never posted ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")  I merely assumed that the discussion was on 1.2-sorry!

Yeah, shadowmage is really transparent in his work---he shows us what's up and coming, and tends to sort of blog his progress here (which is honestly fascinating to read, it's cool to see how the sausage gets made ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") ). As a result, the recent weeks have indeed been all about the 1.2 compatible version---it's just not released to us yet since it's not ready, it's what he's been working on.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-15T16:58:31Z" title="10/15/2016 04:58  PM" data-short="7 yr">October 15, 2016</time> by Jimbodiah**

[@Jimbodiah](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/152759-jimbodiah/)  
  
[http://imgur.com/a/Ba4mn](http://imgur.com/a/Ba4mn)  

Engines sold separately (but they need Aerozine50 and NTO)  

I might make a second Apollo variant with these panels in X like Orion, as I don't know if I can include two configs for the same solar panel on the same part ([@Shadowmage](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138730-shadowmage/), halp), and possibly make a version of the Apollo SM with some panels and a Block III/IV/V from [@CobaltWolf](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105588-cobaltwolf/)'s Apollo SM, in these two last cases, engines included  

(btw, there's an Apollo somewhere in that album)

Initial 1.2 testing release is available:

[https://github.com/shadowmage45/SSTULabs/releases/tag/0.5.33.126](https://github.com/shadowmage45/SSTULabs/releases/tag/0.5.33.126)

Huge change-log.  See the links for details and downloads. WARNING - some save-breaking changes have been made to some parts.  Also a few as-yet unresolved bugs, and a few things that are still TODO.  See the change-log Known Issues section.  Likely a few other broken things in the update that I've not tested/found yet.  Please submit bug reports for any new problems found.

If there are any problems with the custom shaders (for solar panels) please let me know, along with the OS and graphics setup in use (directX, openGL, other options).

This next week will be spent doing a bit more cleanup on the remaining TODO and outstanding problems.  After that work will begin in earnest on the inflatable HAB part geometries and textures.

![FrjAspr.png](http://i.imgur.com/FrjAspr.png)

![fj74eml.png](http://i.imgur.com/fj74eml.png)

I cannot change any tank diameters... I'm in sandbox. Pure SSTU install.

Diameter right-click exists in the MUS tanks (not int he MFT tanks at all), but is disabled. 

So on the MUS tanks, they appear at their default diameter, but when you right-click them they drop to 1.25m.

NEVERMIND.

You'd think that the new "upgrade" behavior would be default in Sandbox (apply all upgrades), but it's not. Make sure to check that box for testing!

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-16T19:31:59Z" title="10/16/2016 07:31  PM" data-short="7 yr">October 16, 2016</time> by tater**

New panels look incredible, no issues that I have seen yet.

Trivial, housecleaning issues:

Solar panels are still in the old "Utility" category, not the new, "Electrical" one.

The SSTU HGA needs to be moved to "Communication" as well.

RBDC needs to move to "Coupling," as do the DP-0P and DP-1P.

In career mode, the engines have no icons in the R&D facility.

In the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> (either mode) there are no icons for engines.

I *love* the spherical tanks.

Now I need a large, round crew compartment ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

The only issue I see with the MFT-S is that the outer structure is not aligned such that the frameworks line up with the default orthogonal locations. Ie: the vertical structures are rotationally offset a few degrees. The MCB-A is aligned properly. You'll notice if you place one against the other.

![misalignment.png](http://i121.photobucket.com/albums/o222/tatersw/KSP/misalignment.png)
